newsitem.title: DUBAI: Oman shares stable, bank shares dominate trade.
newsitem.headline: Oman shares stable, bank shares dominate trade.

text.p: Oman's stock exchange inched up 0.13 percent in moderate trade in the holiday-shortened week to Wednesday with interest focused on bank and investment shares.
The Muscat Securities Market said the index closed at 186.79 points from 186.53.
Of the 52 companies traded in the week -- which was shortened by a two-day national holiday -- shares of 19 rose, 23 fell and the rest were unchanged, the exchange said.
Bank and investment company sectors accounted for 58 percent of total trading value of 2.147 million rials ($5.68 million) from 4.87 million rials the previous week.
Some 895,000 shares changed hands in 461 deals, 51 percent fewer than last week's transactions.
Some 154,000 Oman National Holding Company shares worth 642,000 rials were traded, the exchange said. The stock closed at 4.170 rials from 4.160 a week earlier.
The National Industrial Detergents Company rose 0.80 rials to 3.200 rials. Omani United Insurance Company rose 0.40 rials to 1.910 rials.
